parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post includes a CMF number (CMF 11240002), which is typically associated with electoral campaign materials in Romania.  This strongly suggests the post is related to electoral propaganda.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly mentions Maria Gabriela Horga, a candidate for the Senate, and her affiliation with the PNL (National Liberal Party). It also features images of other PNL affiliated candidates. This directly fulfills "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>As a paid Facebook post, the content is clearly intended to reach a wide audience, not just a select few.  The use of Facebook as a platform further supports this. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post highlights Horga's achievements and her platform, aiming to positively influence voters' perception of her candidacy. The mention of her past legislative work ("52 de legi votate") and her future plans as a senator directly aim to persuade voters to support her. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>While the post presents some factual information about Horga's activities, it lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic reporting. The focus is clearly on promoting Horga's candidacy, not on providing impartial information.  It's not journalism.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The content is not a personal opinion; it's a structured presentation designed to promote a candidate and her party. The positive portrayal of Horga and her accomplishments goes beyond expressing a personal view.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>439880395442886</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all the criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006, Art 36 (7). It refers to a specific candidate (Maria Gabriela Horga), is clearly used for electoral purposes, targets a wide audience, and goes beyond simple journalistic reporting. The presence of a CMF number further reinforces this conclusion. The post's objective is to positively influence voters' opinions of Horga and encourage them to vote for her.  The images of other PNL candidates further strengthen the propaganda aspect.  The post's timing, after the official campaign period, is also a crucial factor.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate>
    <name>Maria Gabriela Horga</name>
    <impact>POSITIVE</impact>
  </candidate>
  <candidate>
    <name>Toma Petcu</name>
    <impact>POSITIVE</impact>
  </candidate>
  <candidate>
    <name>Florin Nidelea</name>
    <impact>POSITIVE</impact>
  </candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>PNL</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Forges Policy, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei postări pe Facebook (ID 439880395442886) cu caracter de propagandă electorală, care promovează candidatul PNL la Senat, Maria Gabriela Horga, precum și alți candidați PNL,  prin evidențierea realizărilor lor și a apartenenței la PNL, având ca efect electoral influențarea pozitivă a votului în favoarea acestora. Postarea, care a generat între 80.000 și 90.000 de impresii,  conține imagini ale candidaților și menționează explicit realizările candidatei Horga, inclusiv numărul de legi votate în mandatul anterior,  cu scopul clar de a-i influența pozitiv pe alegători.  Prezența numărului CMF 11240002 confirmă natura de propagandă electorală a postării.  Postarea a costat între 100 și 199 RON și a fost plătită de Forges Policy, cu datele de contact disponibile în Ad Library: contact@forgespolicy.ro și +40790663007.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
